intro: Senecio orientalis, commonly known as the Eastern Senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green in color. Senecio orientalis is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
